value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">There is a jolt at the points. Lovely as the words are,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the mind slides on to a another rail. To speak them the poet</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">has separated t himself from the 
            <choice>
              <sic>actirs</sic>
              <corr>actors</corr>
            </choice>. He cannot yet make</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><rs type="literary-work" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#lit-tamb" key="Tamburlaine">Tamburlaine</rs> speak those words with his own lips. The play</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">is still in part the work of the 
            <choice>
              <sic>undiffrenetiated</sic>
              <corr>undifferentiated</corr>
            </choice> audience,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">demanding great names, great deeds, simple outlines,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">and not the single subtlety of one soul.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">and <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-fmann" key="Manners, Francis">Lord Rutland</rs>, as <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-rwhy" key="Whyte, Roland">Roland 
            <choice>
              <sic>W ite</sic>
              <corr>Whyte</corr>
            </choice></rs>wrote to <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-rsid" key="Sidney, Robert">Sir Robert</rs></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-rsid">Sidney</rs> <quote source="#" rend="inline">"pass away their time in London, merely in going to</quote></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">plays every day"</quote> But the attraction, strong as it was,</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">that drew them to the <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-bank" key="Bankside">
            <choice>
              <sic>Banside</sic>
              <corr>Bankside</corr>
            </choice></rs>, roused no comment. A <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-wsha" key="Shakespeare, William">young</rs></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-wsha">poet</rs> 
            <choice>
              <sic>dedictes</sic>
              <corr>dedicates</corr>
            </choice>his sonnets to <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-mrwh" key="Mr W. H.">Mr W H.</rs> and not one of those</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">highly educated nobles troubles to ask Who is this patron?</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">It is not a matter of 
            <choice>
              <sic>i nterest</sic>
              <corr>interest</corr>
            </choice> 
            <choice> 
              <sic>i</sic>
              <corr>in</corr>
            </choice> court circles.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">If we try to look at the audience off the stage</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">in their private lives we see only wisps, passing phantoms.</l>
